item.title: The 7 Best Products to Solve Every Winter Skin Problem
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Thanks to the constant fluctuation in temp (switching back and forth between the arctic weather outside and the furnace incubator inside), your skin is pretty much always in need of some TLC this time of year. Here, seven vetted picks for every type of winter woe, from flushed cheeks to scaly elbows and flaky lips.

RELATED: 6 Secrets of Women with Soft Skin

Image credit: Jack Black

Best for Chapped Lips

Best for Chapped Lips

No amount (or shade) of lipstick can cover up peeling skin or flakes. This non-waxy balm prevents any such problem from occurring thanks to copious amounts of shea butter and avocado oil in the formula. Plus, it has a nice matte finish so you can wear it under and over any color to seal in the moisture. 

Jack Black ($8)

RELATED: A Simple (but Slightly Strange) Trick for Treating Chapped Lips

Image credit: L'Occitane

Best for Chapped Hands

Best for Chapped Hands

Fun fact: One tube of this stuff is sold every three seconds around the world—and it’s easy to see why. It’s that rare hand cream that feels super rich going on but doesn’t leave your skin feeling annoyingly greasy afterward.

L’Occitane ($28)

Image credit: CeraVe

Best for Cracked Skin

Best for Cracked Skin

If things have reached a cracking point, this salve will be your new best friend. Developed by top dermatologists to soothe painfully chapped or chafed skin (commonly around your elbows and knees), it also acts as a protective layer to speed up the healing process.

CeraVe ($12)

Image credit: Caudalie

Best for Body Dryness

Best for Body Dryness

Some people don’t step outside of the shower without slathering every inch of their body in lotion—while others hate the feeling of anything extra on their skin. And though you may be able to skate by without it during the summer, you could probably use a little hydration right about now. Luckily, Caudalie’s lightweight oil sinks into skin almost immediately so there’s no heavy residue. (Plus, you’ll no longer have to hide your scaly legs from the pedicurist.) 

Caudalie ($49)

Image credit: Herbivore Botanicals

Best for Breakouts

Best for Breakouts

Breaking out in the winter is the worst because the very products you use to treat acne are suddenly too drying (which often results in a delightful combo of zits and flaky patches). Herbivore’s facial oil helps to balance everything out with a host of natural ingredients like blue tansy and squalane. Press a few drops into cleansed skin daily to keep things in the clear. 

Herbivore Botanicals ($72)

Image credit: Tata Harper Skincare

Best for Dullness

Best for Dullness

It’s fairly hard to get glowing skin in the dead of winter, but a thick layer of Tata Harper’s honey mask will get you pretty darn close. Slather it on when you’re looking especially pallid, queue up an episode of Gilmore Girls and rinse it off after 15 to 30 minutes to bring some life back to your complexion.

Tata Harper ($65)

Image credit: PCA Skin

Best for Redness

Best for Redness

There's the cute, “I just have a little color in my cheeks” flushed…and then there’s angry tomato red. If you fall into the latter camp, apply PCA Skin’s soothing serum twice a day before your moisturizer to calm skin quickly. (Seriously, this stuff is like Visine for the face.) 

PCA Skin ($115)

RELATED: How Purple Makeup Primer Can Change Your Face for the Better

item.title: 5 Totally Appropriate New Year’s Resolutions for Kids
item.description:
Children: They’re not that different from you and me. And much like us, they tend to make lofty New Year’s resolutions, then forget about them once February rolls around. To help, we culled some of the most common kids’ goals, and offered better, more achievable ones.

RELATED: 6 Things in Your Kids' Rooms That Are Distracting Them from Doing Their Homework

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 1

Instead of… “I’ll be nicer to my sister”
“I will play one game with my sister every night before dinner”

Getting siblings to get along is tricky business, but encouraging set playtimes is a good step toward family accord. (At the very least it’ll keep them busy for 20 minutes while you make tacos.)

Image credit: FangXiaNuo/Getty Images

Element 2

Instead of… “I’ll be braver at school”
“I’ll raise my hand three times each week”

For shy kids, the prospect of speaking up is really daunting. Give your little one a modest, specific goal and talk each night about how she’s doing in her quest.

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 5

Instead of… “I’ll eat less junk food”
“I’ll eat a piece of fruit every day with lunch”

Then load that lunchbox up with clementines.

RELATED: 11 Food Art Ideas That Make Mealtime Fun

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 3

Instead of… “I’ll get straight A’s”
“I won’t turn on the TV until I finish my homework”

Grade motivation is a slippery slope. (Sometimes a kid can work his ass off and still get only a B+.) Instead, foster good work habits that will, in the long run, pay off academically.

Image credit: Peopleimages/Getty Images

Element 4

Instead of… “I’ll learn to be a better sleeper”
“I’ll stay in bed until 7 a.m. no matter what”

Hey, a mom can dream, right?

RELATED: The 6 Most Common Sleep Training Methods, Demystified
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 12 Things to Always Have in Your Carry-On Bag
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

As anyone who’s ever been stranded in Denver for 17 hours knows, airline travel often throws a curve ball. But if you’ve got a well-packed carry-on, you’re good to go no matter what happens. Here, 12 things to always have on hand.

RELATED: The 10 Best Travel Hacks We Know

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 1

1. Eye Mask
Whether you’re trying to sleep on a red-eye or in a hotel room where the sunlight pokes in at 5 a.m, an eye mask will help you get the shut-eye you need to feel your best.

2. Antibacterial Wipes
From the airport to the shuttle bus, you’re going to be touching lots of germs. Decrease the ick factor with a pack of Wet Ones.

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 2

3. Layers
Planes can never decide on a temperature. (Hello arctic takeoff and hot-flash-central landing.) Do yourself a favor and pack some options so you can stay comfy throughout flight.

4. Advil
Getting a migraine three hours into your trans-Atlantic is no fun. Always travel with pain-relievers so you can nip it in the bud. 

RELATED: 6 Lifesaving Jet-Lag Remedies Everyone Should Know

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 3

5. Photocopies of your passport
Losing a passport abroad is a complete nightmare, so make sure you have a few photocopies in case of emergency. Keep one in your wallet, one in the pocket of your favorite handbag and heck, even one in your toiletry case.

6. Toothbrush
Feel a little grimy upon landing? Freshen your breath and get on with your life.

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 4

7. Extra Cash
Because who knows when you’ll see another ATM. 

RELATED: FYI, You Can Negotiate The Price of Your Airbnb 

8. Slippers
Is it just us, or is it impossible to get comfortable on a plane when your toes are all jammed into your sneakers?

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 5

9. Refillable Water Bottle
Of course, water won’t be allowed through security, but you can fill up at the nearest water-fountain, then stay hydrated throughout the flight. (These amazing Kleen Kanteen bottles keep water ice-cold for an entire day.)

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 6

10. A Notebook
You don’t have to be a travel blogger to keep a written record of your trip. Pack a journal and pen or pencil so you can jot down thoughts, memories or goals as they come to you.

11. Snacks
Because you are not fun when you’re hangry.

RELATED: This is How You Will Never Lose a Charger Again When You Travel
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 6 of the Best Things That Happened on the Internet in 2016
item.description:
Say what you will about 2016, but it did give us some really solid viral Internet things. Here, six of our favorites.

RELATED: 17 Instagrams We Don’t Want to See in 2017

The Mannequin Challenge

The Mannequin Challenge

Why this video trend (where people are filmed frozen in action while the song “Black Beatles” by Rae Sremmurd plays in the background) took off like it did is a complete mystery to us, but that’s definitely not to say that they aren’t super entertaining (in fact, we may or may not have made one ourselves). While Corden’s intricate take might top the list, these frighteningly adorable little kids are a close second.

Damn Daniel

Damn Daniel

The premise: A high school kid films his friend, Daniel, and keeps saying “Damn, Daniel” over and over again. That’s literally it (plus a mention of white Vans). It makes very little sense when you explain it, but there’s something about watching it that’s downright delightful.

Pizza Rat

Pizza Rat

It might have been a hoax, but the image of a rat dragging a slice of pizza down the stairs of a New York City subway still captured the nation’s attention. Because let’s face it: Haven’t we all been pizza rat at one point in our lives?

Chewbacca Mom

Chewbacca Mom

Candace Payne was a normal mom from Texas when she recorded herself live on Facebook opening and trying on a Chewbacca mask. Her reaction is nothing short of magical—enough so that she caught the eye of James Corden, who had her on his show for a funny segment.

Sad Ben Affleck

Sad Ben Affleck

Ben Affleck and Henry Cavill’s 2016 movie Batman V Superman was almost universally panned by critics. After being asked about the poor reviews, Cavill attempts to defend the film while Affleck sits silently, looking on the verge of tears. Enter the Internet and a pitch-perfect Simon and Garfunkel song and you’ve got a terrifically depressing viral video we’ve watched over and over again.  

Image credit: @sarahnicole103/twitter

#HotDogPrincess

#HotDogPrincess

Little girls in a dance class in North Carolina were allowed to dress up for “princess week,” but instead of mimicking Ariel or Belle, little Ainsley put on her finest hot dog costume and waddled her way into America’s heart. Thank you, Ainsley, for bringing us infinite joy. We have a feeling hot dogs will be huge in 2017.

RELATED: The 2016 Carpool Karaoke Stars Sing “All I Want for Christmas Is You”
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 3 Tricks to Buying an Actually Pretty Decent $10 Bottle of Wine
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

You’re running to the wine shop to pick up a bottle of vino for your neighbor’s holiday dinner. Buy one that’s too expensive and, after all the parties on your calendar, you’ll be in debt by New Year’s. Buy one that’s too affordable and you risk offending the host and her guests. Never fear: Our friends at Wine Library are teaching us how to pick the good stuff, for cheap.

RELATED: How to Make Red Wine Hot Chocolate

Image credit: rustyl3599/Getty Images

Search For Bottles From an Undervalued Region

Search For Bottles From an Undervalued Region

Everyone loves wine from France and Italy, but when you’re angling for a deal, try wine from a more underrated area, like Portugal. You’ll find sweet, fortified port; reds that taste expensive, but aren’t; and a selection of delicious, affordable whites. It might even convince you to book that trip to Lisbon you’ve been putting off all these years.

What to buy: 2015 Passaros Escolha (You can’t miss the cute bird on the label.)

Image credit: Twenty20

Try an Every-Day Wine From a Premium Producer

Try an Everyday Wine From a Premium Producer

A fancy bottle of Brunello di Montalcino can set you back a pretty penny, but a Sangiovese from a Brunello producer doesn’t have to. Some wine producers declassify some of their bottles if they’re using grapes from younger vineyards, trying a new technique or making wine in a style that’s different from what regional regulations dictate. Their markdown is your gain, people. 

What to buy: 2014 Capanne Ricci Ricciolo, from a well-known Brunello producer, is one hell of a pizza wine.

Image credit: Twenty20

Say "Yes" to Dessert Wine

Say "Yes" to Dessert Wine

If you want something sweet for a cheese pairing but would rather spend more on the Brie than the booze, you’re in luck. Dessert wine is typically difficult to produce, so many are pricey, but the sweet white from the Monbazillac region is a total steal.

What to buy: Chateau Vari Monbazillac Reserve Du Chateau (It tastes like it's worth at least three times the price.)

RELATED: Whoops, We’ve Been Slicing Brie Wrong This Whole Time
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 8 Easy Health Hacks You Can Start Doing Right Now
item.description:
It's easy to get off track, health-wise, when you have a hectic week at work or home. Luckily, there are a few easy health hacks you can make to your daily routine to instantly feel lighter, healthier and more alert. You don’t even have to give up that second slice of pizza.

RELATED: 7 Ways to Get More Sleep This Week

Image credit: Twenty20

Eat Without Distractions

Eat Without Distractions

We’re all guilty of scarfing down our salad in front of the computer, but mindlessly munching not only encourages us to consume more, it also takes the pleasure out of one of our favorite activities: eating (duh). So set the table, use utensils and pay attention as you mindfully eat your next lunch.

Image credit: Getty Images/BraunS

Unplug an Hour Before Bed

Unplug an Hour Before Bed

Scrolling through Instagram when you’re supposed to be sleeping? Yep, we’ve been there. Instead of hopping through the endless twists and turns of social media, enforce a “no tech” rule and read a book for an hour before bed. You’ll wake up feeling refreshed and ready to take on the day.

Image credit: Twenty20

Drink Hot Water with Lemon in the Mornings

Drink Hot Water with Lemon in the Mornings

Your yoga teacher is always telling you about the miracle properties of lemon water, so what are you waiting for? The warm water is said to flush your digestive system as you rehydrate, and the lemon has pH-balancing effects.

Image credit: Twenty20

Get Up and Walk Around Every Hour

Get Up and Walk Around Every Hour

When you’re really crunched at work, the whole day can pass before you even notice you haven’t left your desk since 9 a.m. Set an alarm on your phone to get up and walk around at least once an hour. It will help with your concentration and it’s good to get out there and stare at anything other than your computer screen.

Image credit: Twenty20

Take a Cold Shower

Take a Cold Shower

Are you brave enough to jump into a cold shower in the middle of winter? If you are, you’ll be handsomely rewarded. Not only is a cold shower said to improve circulation and tighten pores, it’s also been linked to increased alertness and boosted immunity. We swear it’s not so bad once you take the plunge.

Image credit: Twenty20

Take a Whiff of Citrus

Take a Whiff of Citrus

Yep, seriously. The scent of lemons and oranges is proven to reduce anxiety and improve your mood. If you’re not the type to eat an afternoon clementine, try buying some essential oil for the same effect.

Image credit: Stockbyte/Getty Images

Floss Your Teeth

Floss Your Teeth

Do we really need to explain this one to you? You’ll feel fresher, your gums will thank you and you’ll never have to lie to your dentist again.

Image credit: Hydro Flask

Bring a Water Bottle with You Everywhere You Go

Bring a Water Bottle with You Everywhere You Go

Staying hydrated is the foundation of good health, period. To ensure you’re getting all the H20 your body craves, keep a water bottle on hand at all times. You’ll never find yourself stuck on a delayed train car with a parched throat again. We love these hydro flasks that keep your liquids cold (or warm) for up to 25 hours.

RELATED: What Your Food Cravings Are Saying About Your Health
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 10 Easy Ways to Burn 100 Calories Right This Second
item.description:
The best kind of exercise is exercise that doesn’t feel like a chore. As in, it’s not painful. Below, ten super-simple ways to burn 100 calories without really thinking about it. (Note: The following calorie calculations are based on a 150-pound woman.)

RELATED: 23 Easy Ways to Cut 4,000 Calories Each Week

Image credit: Squaredpixels/Getty Images

Dance Like No One's Watching (20 Minutes)

Dance Like No One's Watching (20 Minutes)

Create a playlist of upbeat songs (ones with a tempo between 120 and 140 beats per minute are the best at keeping you motivated, according to sport psychologist Dr. Costas Karageorghis) and dance like you’re Jennifer Beals in an off-the-shoulder sweatshirt. The time will fly by—and in the end, you’ll be dripping with sweat. We promise.

Image credit: Twenty20

Chase the Dog (30 Minutes)

Chase the Dog (30 Minutes)

Your pup is your very own four-legged personal trainer. He’ll play fetch, run in circles in the grass and show you all of his favorite places to sniff. In the time it takes to watch a Friends rerun, you’ll have bonded with Fido and gotten some fresh air. Win-win.

Image credit: SolisImages/Getty Images

Create Your Own Circuit Workout (10 Minutes)

Create Your Own Circuit Workout (10 Minutes)

No time for the gym? Try this quick and easy workout recommended by Eric Salvador, head instructor at The Fhitting Room in New York City. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, then bend your knees into a squat. Repeat ten times, then follow it with ten push-ups and ten crunches. Repeat for ten minutes and bam: You’ve just burned 100 calories in your living room.

Image credit: PeopleImages/Getty Images

Sit on an Exercise Ball (1 Hour)

Sit on an Exercise Ball (1 Hour)

You’ve heard that “sitting is the new smoking,” but that kinda depends on how you’re sitting. Slumping over in a chair from nine to five is a recipe for back and neck pain, but siting up straight on an exercise ball, with your feet flat on the floor and engaging your core burns about 100 calories in just an hour.

RELATED: 8 Things You Need to Do If You Sit at a Desk All Day

Image credit: NKS_Imagery/Getty Images

Go for a Quick Bike Ride (15 Minutes)

Go for a Quick Bike Ride (15 Minutes)

You might not have 45 minutes to devote to a spin class, but if you can get outside (weather permitting), bike riding is a fun way to torch a bunch of calories really quickly.

Image credit: Geber86/Getty Images

Watch a Funny Movie (1 Hour, 30 Minutes)

Watch a Funny Movie (1 Hour, 30 Minutes)

OK, you have, like, no excuse not to take advantage of this one. It turns out, laughing burns between ten and 40 calories per ten minutes, meaning a single viewing of Mean Girls is sure to equal at least 100 cals.

RELATED: 40 Movies Every Woman Should See Before She’s 40

Image credit: kazoka30/Getty Images

Cook a Delicious and Healthy Meal (45 Minutes)

Cook a Delicious and Healthy Meal (45 Minutes)

The keyword here is healthy, but chopping, sautéing and doing all those other things associated with food prep burns 100 calories in just 45 minutes. Yes, you’ll replenish those calories pretty much immediately, but assuming the meal is healthy, it’s more than worth the preemptive burn.

RELATED: 17 Cold-Weather Dinners That Won’t Ruin Your Diet

Image credit: bluecinema/Getty Images

Play with Your Kids (25 Minutes)

Play with Your Kids (25 Minutes)

You know your kiddos tire you out, but did you know they give you a pretty good workout too? Get silly with the little ones for a mere 25 minutes to burn 100 calories. Plus, chances are 25 minutes won’t make them sleepy, so you’re probably in for even more calorie burning.

Image credit: PeopleImages/Getty Images

Go Shopping (38 Minutes)

Go Shopping (38 Minutes)

We’ll be honest: We’ve rolled our eyes more than once at those “shopping is my cardio” shirts. But it actually is a fairly effective stand-in for exercise. Hitting the stores for about 40 minutes—trying things on, walking between shops, lifting bags of new clothes—burns 100 calories and countless more dollars.

Image credit: gpointstudio/Getty Images

Try a Hairstyle You Saw on Pinterest (35 Minutes)

Try a Hairstyle You Saw on Pinterest (35 Minutes)

Or just stick to your normal blowout. Either way, holding your arms in the air, drying and styling your hair burns 100 calories in 35 minutes. Yet another reason to give that low braided updo a try.

RELATED: 23 New Hair Tricks You Need to Try Right Now
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Ombré Lips Are the Prettiest Trend You Haven’t Tried Yet
item.description:
Image credit: Laura Wing-Kamoosi

If wearing lipstick isn’t something you do on the regular, we’ve got just the trend for easing your way into it. Literally. This ombré lip color starts off vibrant in the middle, then gradually softens and fades into the color of your skin. Lipstick enthusiasts: You're welcome to give it a whirl as well.

Step 1: Start with a nude lipstick and apply all over.

Step 2: Take another lipstick (something with more color) and use a brush to dab it on lightly, focusing on the center of your pout.

Step 3: Time to mix! Use your finger to pat on some lip balm, blending the lipstick color outward into the nude.

RELATED: The One Red Lipstick That Works for Every Skin Tone
item.media:description: Ombré Lips Are the Prettiest Trend You Haven’t Tried Yet

item.title: New Study Says Female Doctors are Better Than Male Doctors
item.description:
Image credit: Hulu

Whoa, mic drop: A new study from Harvard University just found that female physicians are better at taking care of elderly patients than male doctors.

Yep, the study—published this week in the academic journal JAMA Internal Medicine—explains that a whopping “32,000 fewer patients would die if male physicians could achieve the same outcomes as female physicians every year.”

Here’s why: Based on previous research, female doctors tend to spend more time per appointment with their patients and stick more closely to clinical guidelines than males. They’re also much more likely to call in those super-important preventative tests like your annual mammogram or pap smear.

Clearly, male docs have a thing or two to learn from their female counterparts. (Cue the conversations about the gender pay gap.)

RELATED: 5 Reasons It’s Actually Awesome to Get Pregnant After 35
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 6 Secrets of Women Who Always Get Promoted
item.description:
Image credit: AMC

You put in the effort and the overtime—but, for some reason, you’re still not rising up the ranks. Here, six secrets of women who always get promoted…and what you can do to follow a similar path.

RELATED: The 8 Biggest Job Trends for 2017

Image credit: Fox 2000 Pictures

They Don’t Expect Their Boss to Be a Mind Reader

They Don’t Expect Their Boss to Be a Mind Reader

It’s all about communicating your goals. Time is money and your boss is crazy busy. Even if all you have is five minutes, it’s up to you to shape the conversation and be crystal clear about what you’re hoping to accomplish over a set time period. (Say, the next six months.)

Image credit: Twentieth Century Fox

They Keep a Running Log of Their Achievements

They Keep a Running Log of Their Achievements

Even if you think you have a photographic memory, it never hurts to jot down a list of your accomplishments as they happen in real time. For example, that day you nailed the PowerPoint presentation or the month you shouldered two times the workload when your team was short-staffed. Come review time, it can be a challenge to remember every individual feat—but not if you wrote it down.

Image credit: ABC

They Tend to Their Personal Brand

They Tend to Their Personal Brand

Social Media 101: If your boss follows you on Twitter, pay attention to what you post. In other words, think of social media as a tool to amplify your expertise and workplace relevance (hello, Insta from that cool trade show) versus a place to go on inappropriate or poorly punctuated rants.

RELATED: 10 Things You Should Never Post to Social Media

Image credit: NBC

They Network Internally—and Externally

They Network Internally—and Externally

Maybe you never have to work with Joanne in accounting. So what? Striking up inter-departmental relationships can increase your company presence and show your boss you’re a team player. On the flip side, networking outside the office (and within your field) is also a good idea, since it gives you a chance to size up the marketplace and get a sense of your value and worth. (Useful info to keep in your back pocket when it’s time for your review.)

Image credit: AMC

They Never Skip the Office Party

They Never Skip the Office Party

Ten points for old-fashioned face time. Showing up—even if it’s lame or you can only stay for one glass of wine—sends the message you’re putting in effort beyond what’s required.

Image credit: NBC

They're Drama-Free

They're Drama-Free

Leadership potential is the number one prerequisite to moving up the ranks. But if you get lost in workplace gossip or make waves over basic tasks, it reflects poorly—and can sink your chances of getting ahead. 

RELATED: 9 Things That Might Happen If You Dress Up Every Day
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 5 Eyeliner Tricks You’ll Want to Bust Out in 2017
item.description:
Your annual holiday party doesn’t have to be your only excuse to rock a bold eye. In fact, a little makeup fun every so often is the perfect thing to get you through these upcoming dark winter months. Here are the five best eyeliner tricks we learned this year, so you can whip them out in the new year. 

RELATED: The Ultimate Guide to Eyeliner

The Post-It-Note Cat Eye

The Post-It-Note Cat Eye

The cat eye might be nothing new, but the method by which you apply it is. Yep, you stick a Post-It note to your face, and it will be the steady stencil you need.

The Graphic Cat Eye

The Graphic Cat Eye

To take your cat eyes up a notch, draw a second line above your eyelid. People won’t know what hit them when you bat your lashes.

The Double-Winged Kitten Eye

The Double-Winged Kitten Eye

For a less aggressive (but equally adorable) approach, try just a tiny flick of your eyeliner. Aka the kitten eye. We love it so much, we do it twice.

RELATED: How to Do a Glossy Eye for a Night Out

The Gilded Eye

The Gilded Eye

Not all eyeliner looks have to be complicated. Sometimes you just need a glittery eyeliner…and some confidence.

The Turquoise Eye

The Turquoise Eye

Same goes for a bright blue eyeliner. You got this.

RELATED: A Burgundy Smoky Eye Is the Perfect Eye Makeup Update

item.title: The 11 Most Gorgeous Winter Wonderlands to Pin on Pinterest
item.description:
Image credit: EastVillageImages/Getty Images

Forget that we’ve ever complained about the cold because, in reality, the snowy winter happens to be the dreamiest season. To prove it, we rounded up 11 amazing winter wonderlands around the world, which you can find below or on PureWow’s travel Pinterest board.

RELATED: 8 Ski Resorts That Non-Skiers Will Love This Winter

Image credit: Le collectioniste

Verbier, Switzerland

Verbier, Switzerland

You, too, can soak in this view of the Swiss Alps with a mug of hot chocolate in hand…for a price. But hey, who doesn't dream of cozying up in a luxurious six-bedroom chalet in the glamorous ski town of Verbier?

Vail, Colorado

Vail, Colorado

Dashing through the snow…snuggled beneath flannel blankets, of course.

Image credit: EastVillageImages/Getty Images

New York, New York

New York, New York

A snow-swept Central Park view like this will make you forget all about the ungodly temps.

Image credit: Hotel Villa Honegg/Facebook

Ennetbürgen, Switzerland

Ennetbürgen, Switzerland

This 23-room boutique hotel offers a gorgeous backdrop no matter what time of year you visit, but winter is the most magical. Oh, BTW, that’s a bird’s-eye view of Lake Lucerne beneath those snow-capped mountains.

Image credit: Kkslauttanen Arctic Resort/Facebook

Lapland, Finland

Lapland, Finland

Just imagine how the Northern Lights look from your personal glass igloo. At this dream-like resort located above the Arctic Circle, you can see for yourself.

Image credit: Scott Dunn

Val d'Isère, France

Val d'Isère, France

If you get bored of the heated indoor pool, this award-winning chalet on the French-Italian border also has indoor and outdoor jacuzzis and a sauna.

Image credit: Badrutt’s Palace Hotel/Facebook

ST. MORITZ, SWITZERLAND

ST. MORITZ, SWITZERLAND

Is it just us or did Badrutt’s Palace Hotel emerge from the stories of a fairy-tale? Actually, the entire Alpine town of St. Moritz looks too adorable to be real.

RELATED: The 15 Most Adorable Small Towns in Europe

Image credit: DawnKey/Getty Images

A Cozy Cabin...anywhere

A Cozy Ski Cabin...anywhere

If you need us, we’ll be warming up by the fire.

Image credit: Amangani Jackson Hole

Jackson Hole, Wyoming

Jackson Hole, Wyoming

We’d travel out west just for a dip in this incredible Jacuzzi with a view at the chic Amangani mountain resort.

Image credit: Inigofotografia/Getty Images

Reine, Norway

Reine, Norway

The newest place on our travel bucket list: the tiny fishing village of Reine, Norway, in the remote Lofoten Islands (just for a peep of these Northern Lights).

RELATED: The 11 Most Spectacular Cities to See During Winter

Image credit: Le Collectionist

Meribél, France

Méribel, France

You know what? We're going to stay in bed all day and admire the view from our six-bedroom French Alpine chalet. Maybe we'll get up later to catch a movie in the home cinema.

item.title: This Is Your Celeb BFF, Based on Your Zodiac Sign
item.description:
Peanut butter and jelly. Sweet tea and lemonade. Netflix and wine. There are just some things that go together perfectly, and we think you and your celeb girl crush are no exception. So we set out to find your ideal best friend based on concrete evidence—your Zodiac, of course. Read on to find out who your ultimate gal pal is.

RELATED: Your January Horoscope Has Arrived

Image credit: Jeffrey Mayer/Getty Images

Your Sign: Sagittarius; Your BFF: Aquarius (Jan. 20 to Feb. 18)

Your Sign: Sagittarius; Your BFF: Aquarius (Jan. 20 to Feb. 18)

You get a BFF! And you get a BFF! And you get a BFF! Yep, Oprah Winfrey is your perfect lighthearted friend to balance out your sometimes serious disposition. She’ll keep things fun but also not let your unfailing optimism get the best of you with her brutal honesty. Fact: You two are a match made in talk-show heaven.

Image credit: Mike Marsland/Getty Images

Your Sign: Capricorn; Your BFF: Taurus (April 20 to May 20)

Your Sign: Capricorn; Your BFF: Taurus (April 20 to May 20)

Hellooooo…it’s Adele. You two are the ideal pair: Her determination and unwavering persistence (to be, like, one of the most influential women in the world) is the ideal compliment to your practical outlook and ability to get stuff done. With her by your side, you can literally conquer the world.

Image credit: Steve Granitz/Getty Images

Your Sign: Aquarius; Your BFF: Sagittarius (Nov. 22 to Dec. 21)

Your Sign: Aquarius; Your BFF: Sagittarius (Nov. 22 to Dec. 21)

As the most amiable sign there is, it’s not hard for you, dear Aquarius, to make friends. The tricky part is finding someone to really keep up with your creativity and intelligence—someone who isn’t afraid of a 1 a.m. phone call just to chat about the meaning of life and love. Amanda's as reliable as they get: She'll pick up, every time.

Image credit: Steve Granitz/Getty Images

Your Sign: Pisces; Your BFF: Cancer (June 21 to July 22)

Your Sign: Pisces; Your BFF: Cancer (June 21 to July 22)

You sweet, sensitive soul. Sofia’s here to hug you till you burst and to bring out your bubbly side, whether it be with her vivacious personality or her genuine love for everyone and everything. You two would get along like peas in a pod.

Image credit: Jeffrey Mayer/Getty Images

Your Sign: Aries; Your BFF: Gemini (May 21 to June 20)

Your Sign: Aries; Your BFF: Gemini (May 21 to June 20)

Need a laugh, Aries? On your own, you’re adventurous and confident, but you want a pal who doesn’t take life too seriously and let’s you laugh at yourself every once in awhile. Or, ya know, you could both just laugh at her. (She’s pretty damn funny.) 

RELATED: Amy Schumer Wins the Met Gala By Showing the World Her Deodorant Hack

Image credit: Jason LaVeris/Getty Images

Your Sign: Taurus; Your BFF: Capricorn (Dec. 22 to Jan. 19)

Your Sign: Taurus; Your BFF: Capricorn (Dec. 22 to Jan. 19)

There’s something to be said for your natural confidence, Taurus, but isn’t it nice to find someone with more of an offbeat sense of humor? Someone that helps you let down your guard? Zooey’s quirkiness and caprice are the perfect combo when you’re searching for a loyal shoulder to lean on (with a bit of added eccentricity). 

Image credit: Steve Granitz/Getty Images

Your Sign: Gemini; Your BFF: Aries (March 21 to April 19)

Your Sign: Gemini; Your BFF: Aries (March 21 to April 19)

This sweet Southern belle will always know how to cheer you up when you’re feeling low. She also shares your love of girl talk, meaning you two could gab for hours over a bottle of wine without a care in the world. As an adventurer, you need someone as lively and upbeat as you. Reese is your girl. 

RELATED: Every Reese Witherspoon Movie, Ranked

Image credit: Amanda Edwards/Getty Images

Your Sign: Cancer; Your BFF: Pisces (Feb. 19 to March 20)

Your Sign: Cancer; Your BFF: Pisces (Feb. 19 to March 20)

Pisces is your strongest match, Cancer, because you both know the importance of just chilling out together and forgetting the stresses of the world. Just like you, Drew is compassionate and sensitive and doesn’t mind that you tend to overcommunicate your feelings—she’s the perfect listener.

Image credit: Amanda Edwards/Getty Images

Your Sign: Leo; Your BFF: Libra (Sept. 23 to Oct. 22)

Your Sign: Leo; Your BFF: Libra (Sept. 23 to Oct. 22)

Your ideal lady friend is someone willing to balance out your passionate disposition, and Libras like Frieda are great for keeping you at an even keel. Calm, level-headed and always loyal, she’s your go-to when the going gets tough, or just when you need an honest and fair opinion about that awful bridesmaid dress.

Image credit: Laurent Viteur/Getty Images

Your Sign: Virgo; Your BFF: Scorpio (Oct. 23 to Nov. 21)

Your Sign: Virgo; Your BFF: Scorpio (Oct. 23 to Nov. 21)

Your one pursuit in life, sweet Virgo, is to love and be loved, and what better person than the most compassionate Scorpio? Julia’s your faithful friend with a magnetic force that won’t let you two stay separated for longer than a few days...or until the next Pretty Woman viewing night.  

Image credit: Allen Berezovsky/Getty Image

Your Sign: Libra; Your BFF: Leo (July 23 to Aug. 22)

Your Sign: Libra; Your BFF: Leo (July 23 to Aug. 22)

As a social butterfly, you gravitate toward those who are more outspoken and care less what others think than you. J. Law, who fell not once but twice at the Oscars and managed to get back up with a grin on her face, is a pro at keeping you grounded and not letting you take life too seriously.

Image credit: Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images

Your Sign: Scorpio; Your BFF: Virgo (Aug. 23 to Sept. 22)

Your Sign: Scorpio; Your BFF: Virgo (Aug. 23 to Sept. 22)

Bow down to your bestie, Queen B. She won’t mind sharing the throne for someone just as dedicated and hard working as herself. You two are emotional beings—almost to a flaw—but it helps you both understand each other and the struggles and triumphs of this game we call life. Keep pushing each other to be the best, but at the end of the day, remember you’re both only human. So go ahead, split the dessert.

item.title: 10 New Year's Quotes to Get You Pumped for 2017
item.description:
Image credit: Getty Images/Petar Chernaev

We know New Year’s resolutions aren’t for everyone, but there’s something so uplifting about wiping the slate clean come January 1. Even if you aren’t one for upheaving your life every year, now is as good a time as any to reset your mind and refocus on your priorities. Here, ten of our favorite thinkers and writers reflect on what the new year means to them.

﻿RELATED: ﻿9 Words You Should Say Less in 2017

“Let our New Year's resolution be this: We will be there for one another as fellow members of humanity, in the finest sense of the word.” - Göran Persson

"New Year's resolution: To tolerate fools more gladly, provided this does not encourage them to take up more of my time." - James Agate 

"Cheers to a new year and another chance for us to get it right." - Oprah Winfrey 

"And now we welcome the new year. Full of things that have never been." - Rainer Maria Rilke 

"For last year's words belong to last year's language and next year's words await another voice." - T.S. Eliot 

"New Year—a new chapter, new verse, or just the same old story? Ultimately we write it. The choice is ours." - Alex Morritt 

"The road ahead is not some predetermined path that I am forced to trod, but it is a rich byway that I can help create." - Craig D. Lounsbrough 

"What the New Year brings to you will depend a great deal on what you bring to the New Year." -  Vern McLellan 

"This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change." - Taylor Swift

 

"Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year." - Ralph Waldo Emerson 

﻿RELATED: ﻿15 Holiday Quotes to Spread Some Serious Christmas Cheer
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: How to Make No-Bake Snowball Cookie Pops
item.description:
Image credit: Laura Wing-Kamoosi

We’ve had to shovel snow only once or twice this year, but already we’re totally over it. These, however, are the kind of snowballs we wouldn’t mind having around all year long. Made with just three ingredients (and no oven necessary), everyone can lend a hand in making this sweet treat. Watch to see how it’s done.

Step 1: Start with one box of Oreo cookies and crush them up in a large mixing bowl.

Step 2: Add 8 oz. cream cheese and mix until it's completely incorporated.

Step 3: Roll the mixture into balls and place them on a lined baking sheet or plate. Then, stick 'em in the freezer and wait until they’re firm.

Step 4: Stick a kebab or popsicle stick in each ball and dip in melted white chocolate.

Step 5: Add brightly colored sprinkles, then pop them back in the fridge for a few minutes. Now go ahead and take a test bite, you know, just to make sure they’re as good as they look. (Trust us: They are.)

RELATED: How to Decorate Holiday Cookies with a Toddler

item.title: The 11 Best Organizing Tips We Learned This Year
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Amidst all the chaos of the holidays, a clear, well-thought-out space is crucial to our sanity. Here, the 11 best (and most efficient) organizing tips we learned this year. Consider it an early Christmas gift from us.

RELATED: 8 Secrets of People Who Don't Have Clutter

Image credit: Twenty20

Separate Your Closet By Occasion

Separate Your Closet By Occasion

You know, instead of by color or by item (pants with pants, skirts with skirts, etc.) This way you have a designated spot for office-ready ensembles and another for weekend brunch plans.

Image credit: Twenty20

Put a Hook on the Front of Your Closet

Put a Hook on the Front of Your Closet

So you can easily plan your outfit for the next day. Just hang all the pieces right where you can grab them in the morning.

RELATED: 5 Secrets of Women with Perfectly Organized Closets

Image credit: Le Creuset

Store Your Pots With the Knobs Facing Down

Store Your Pots With the Lid Facing Down

This creates a flat surface so you can easily stack your pots and lids instead of having a bunch of mismatched parts rolling around your cabinet. 

Image credit: Martha Stewart

Place Your Cutting Boards in a Slotted File Organizer

Place Your Cutting Boards in a Slotted File Organizer

Ditto for your muffin pans, baking trays and cooling racks.

RELATED: The Ultimate Guide to Styling Your Kitchen

Image credit: Adler & Co

Tuck Your Sheet Sets Inside a Pillow Case

Tuck Your Sheet Sets Inside a Pillowcase

Then stack them according to which room they’ll be used in. 

Image credit: A Beautiful Mess

Get Yourslf More Bathroom Storage

Get Yourself More Bathroom Storage

Just add a slim ledge between your sink and mirror. It’s easy to install and it provides a perfect resting place for small necessities like hand soap and decorative items like fancy candles and vases.

Image credit: Mona Luna

Make Your Own Accessories Rack

Make Your Own Accessories Rack

With a simple corkboard, a decorative frame and some pushpins. Keep your longer chains at the bottom so they don’t get tangled with everything else.

Image credit: Twenty20

Use Your Suitcases to Store Out-Of-Season Clothing

Use Your Suitcases to Store Out-Of-Season Clothing

Do you really need your swimsuits right this second?

Image credit: Transform

Use Baskets to Compartmentalize Your Pantry

Use Baskets to Compartmentalize Your Pantry

And designate a category for each. (One for baking supplies, another for kids’ snacks, another for general canned goods, etc.) No more digging around for that bottle of vanilla extract the next time you make cookies. 

Image credit: Lowe's

Compartmentalize Your Garbage, Too

Compartmentalize Your Garbage, Too

Always have a bunch of empty water bottles in your mudroom? If you have dedicated recycling bins (preferably tucked away or built into a cabinet), you are far more likely to keep trash out of sight until collection day arrives.

Image credit: Twenty20

And Finally, Don't Forget the Digital Clutter

And Finally, Don't Forget the Digital Clutter

Lest you get another “not enough storage” message the next time you go to photograph your meal. (Though maybe we should all stop doing that.) Luckily, tons of apps can streamline the process for you.

RELATED: 7 Things You Should Delete from Your Phone Right Now
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 6 Clever Ways to Keep Your Kids Off Their Phones
item.description:
Remember your children's eyes? You know, those precious little things that used to stare up at you with curiosity and adoration before you caved and bought everyone cell phones and now they’re glued to Snapchat at all times? Here, six easy ways to get your kids off their phones and back into the habit of family conversation.

RELATED: 5 Genius Ways to Get Your Kids Off the Couch in Cold Weather

Keep the Charging Station Downstairs

Keep the Charging Station Downstairs

If kids are allowed to juice up in their bedrooms, they will definitely, definitely be on the Internet until the wee hours of the morning. Make everyone (yourself included) plug in in a neutral spot (say, the kitchen) before heading upstairs for the evening.

Turn Off the Wi-Fi After Dark

Turn Off the Wi-Fi After Dark

Or just turn off your modem after a certain hour every night. Yes, it may affect your ability to steam Westworld, but haven’t you been meaning to read more books anyway?

Make Your Kids Pay Their Own Overage Bills

Make Your Kids Pay Their Own Overage Bills

Limit your data plan to whatever you think is reasonable and make your children foot the bill if they go over their allotted usage. Nothing motivates like money, right?

Have a "No Phones in the Car" Policy

Have a "No Phones in the Car" Policy

Car rides can be some of the best times to chat with your kids about their lives. (OMG, Mr. Gaston did not make everyone retake the chem test!) Make a rule that nobody is allowed to whip out their phone in the car, or if your clan needs extra motivation, give them an analog task like fielding directions or manning the radio.

Ask for Dramatic Readings

Ask for Dramatic Readings

We spoke to one mom who, when she catches her 14-year-old texting at the dinner table, will demand a dramatic reading of the exchange. Nine times out of ten, it's the most boring conversation ever, but it's still a motivator.

Set a Good Example

Set a Good Example

This is probably the hardest of the six, but it's so important for raising socially engaged non-phone-addicted little angels: Put down your devices as much as possible. Yes, this might mean not writing back to your boss right away or holding on that #tbt gram until tomorrow. But trust that it's worth it in the long run. After all, monkey see, monkey do.

RELATED: 5 Ways We Can Empower Our Daughters
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Science Confirms: Pregnancy Brain is Totally a Thing
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

If you’ve ever been pregnant, you’ve probably blamed everything from misplacing the remote to forgetting your sister-in-law’s name on “pregnancy brain.” If you’ve never been pregnant, you’ve probably rolled your eyes at that excuse.

If you fall in the latter camp, you owe your mom friends an apology. That’s because a study published in the journal Nature Neuroscience just confirmed not only that pregnancy brain is real, but also that it might last for up to two years after a pregnancy.

The study, which followed 25 women in their 30s in Spain over five years, found that making another human being changes the size and structure of parts of the brain that deal with perceiving feelings and empathy. What’s more, most of these changes remained for up to two years.

Another strange slash sweet detail? Scientists also found that the more gray matter a woman lost, the more emotionally attached to her baby she tended to be.

So the next time your pregnant pal flakes on your dinner date, cut her some slack—it’s the baby’s fault.

RELATED: 12 Crazy Things That Happen to Your Body When You’re Pregnant
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 15 Items Under Your Sink You Should Throw Away Right Now
item.description:
You’ve organized your bathroom, kitchen and guest bedroom. The only thing left on your list is the scary space under your kitchen sink. Sure, it holds all your cleaning supplies, but it’s probably the messiest place in your whole house. Here, 15 things to toss right now. 

RELATED: The Lazy Gal’s Guide to Cleaning the House Before the Holidays

Element 1

1. Almost-empty bottles of cleaning products. Spray that drop of Lysol on your coffee table and be done with it.

2. Expired cleaning products. Antibacterial ingredients can lose shelf life over time. (Plus, that rusty can of Borax looks like it’s from the dark ages.)

3. Trash bags that don’t fit any container in your house. If they rip every time you try to use them, it’s time to go.

4. Old plastic grocery bags. There will always, always be more.

Element 2

5. Old rodent traps. They’ve made strides in technology since you last saw a mouse in your home 15 years ago.  

6. Old, dried out sponges. There will always be more. We promise.

7. Gross rags. That holey undershirt was tossed under there with good intent, but you’ve got real cleaning towels for a reason.

Element 3

8. An ancient fire extinguisher. It might not even work. You can use a pressure gauge to test it, or head to your local hardware store and get a replacement.

9. Single rose vases. These are pointless and unnecessary and we own six of them.

10. Your neighbor’s casserole dish. And if it’s still got brownie residue, double oops. Return it in sparkling condition and apologize profusely.

Element 4

11. Old toothbrushes you were going to use to scrub the stove. Technology, people.

12. An empty fishbowl. RIP, Goldie.

13. A disgusting dustpan. It’s seen far too much.

Image credit: Getty Images

14. Busted flashlights. You’ll need one to find anything under there, but you might want to replace the batteries first.

15. Anything that could be damaged by water. If your sink leaks, you’ll be really glad you put those screwdrivers in the basement.

RELATED: 10 Kitchen Items You Should Throw Away Right Now
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 7 Ways to Actually Keep Your New Year's Resolutions
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

It’s January, and you feel hopeful and motivated to have the best year ever. And so you start to set your resolutions. (I will lose weight. I will get a new job. I will watch less Netflix.) But come March, you’ve lost steam and focus. Here, some manageable tips for following through with your goals. (For real this time.)

RELATED: 5 Ways to Be More Present in Your Life

Image credit: Twenty20

Be Specific About Your Goals

Be Specific About Your Goals

Transform those sweeping proclamations into quantifiable objectives. For example, instead of vaguely saying that you’ll lose weight, say you’ll drop 10 pounds. Or instead of vowing to keep in better touch with your grandma this year, decide to call her once a week. The more specific your goal is, the better you can track your progress along the way.

Image credit: Twenty20

Buddy Up With a Partner

Buddy Up With a Partner

When it’s a team effort, resolutions feel less like work and more like fun. Want to work out twice a week in 2017? Make regular gym dates with a friend. Team up with a colleague and try productivity challenges at the office—turn off all email and social media alerts for an hour and commit that time to working on your most annoying task for the day. It’s all about finding someone to hold you accountable when you’re feeling distracted, tired, or, you know, human.

Image credit: Twenty20

Prioritize Time in Your Schedule

Prioritize Time in Your Schedule

Fact: You’ll never be able to “find the time” to do something. It’s a daily choice you have to make for yourself. Whether it’s trying to pad your savings with an extra 10K this year or keeping a clean home, schedule off blocks of time in your calendar to devote yourself to these tasks. Then, treat them like a doctor’s appointment or work deadline you absolutely can’t miss.

Image credit: Twenty20

Share (But Don't Overshare)

Share (But Don't Overshare)

We hate to say it, but your annoying friend from high school who is always posting on Facebook about her gym workouts and healthy meals is more likely to stick to her goals. You’re much less likely to bail when you have other people watching. Just maybe keep the posts to no more than once a day and pick one channel (not Facebook and Twitter and Instagram).

RELATED: 11 Things Workout Enthusiasts Need to Stop Posting on Social Media

Image credit: Twenty20

Check In From Time to Time

Check In From Time to Time

…Which should be easy since you set quantifiable goals to begin with, right? Seeing your progress—no matter how incremental—will motivate you to keep going (and let you know when you might need to readjust your plan of attack).

Image credit: Twenty20

Reward Yourself

Reward Yourself

Set up a treat for yourself whenever you reach a benchmark. Just make sure that whatever it is doesn’t derail your hard work. Lost two pounds? Get a massage. Called grandma for three weeks in a row? Go ahead and have some fro-yo.

Image credit: Twenty20

Be Patient With Yourself

Be Patient With Yourself

It’s not all or nothing. Progress takes time and is never linear. Sometimes, after a long day at work, you’ll skip your workout and binge-eat fries…while binge-watching Gilmore Girls. It’s OK. You didn’t fail at your goals. Just start fresh the next day and keep going. You’ve got this.

RELATED: 6 Ways to Get Over a Slump and Get Motivated
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 8 Fabulous Nail Polish Colors to Wear in the Dead of Winter
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

By now any summer tan we once had has faded into...well, let’s just call it our “natural state.” Here, eight foolproof shades that brighten things up without looking unseasonal (or, worse, garish).

RELATED: The Best Nail Polish Colors for Every Zodiac Sign

Image credit: Jin Soon

A Deep Burgundy

A Deep Burgundy

This is the type of color that you don’t have to think about when you’re trying to pick something at the salon. It’s just as classic as your candy-apple reds but a touch more refined for this time of year—and it looks equally good on your fingers as it does on your toes.

Jin Soon ($18)

Image credit: LVX

A Bright Plum

A Bright Plum

Though if you prefer something on the brighter side (perhaps a little something to perk you up during yet another gray winter day), try a juicy plum or raspberry. It’s cheery and feminine and slightly less expected. 

LVX ($18)

Image credit: Nails Inc.

A Bluish Gray

A Bluish Gray

A cool dove color feels fresher than, say, another run-of-the-mill beige, but it’s just as neutral.

Nails Inc. ($27)

Image credit: Sally Hansen

A Dark Navy

A Dark Navy

A deep navy is a bit edgier while still feeling clean and chic. Wear it on short, squared-off nails and pair the shade with your most feminine frocks to create a nice visual contrast.

Sally Hansen ($8)

﻿RELATED: 7 Unexpected Ways to Layer Dresses into Winter Outfits

Image credit: Essie

A Crisp Forest Green

A Crisp Forest Green

Another alternative? A rich pine green—which is livelier than black, softer than navy and every bit as refined. Again, dark shades tend to look more elegant on shorter nails, but perhaps round off the tips a bit for this particular hue to soften the overall look.

Essie ($12)

Image credit: Chanel

A Creamy Mocha

A Creamy Mocha

And if a nude is your M.O. no matter what season you’re in, opt for a tawnier hue that’s a shade or two darker than your skin.

﻿Chanel ($28)

Image credit: Deborah Lippmann

A Gunmetal Metallic

A Gunmetal Metallic

Just shimmery enough, a dark gunmetal is a good option for ladies who love shiny things but are feeling a bit fatigued from the chunky glitters and super shiny metallics of the holiday season. 

Deborah Lippmann ($18)

﻿RELATED: How to Dry Painted Nails in a Flash

Image credit: Christian Dior

A Pink Tint

A Pink Tint

And if you don't have enough time to commit to a full mani, swipe a coat of sheer pink to brighten nails and add shine. (Bonus: You don't have to be too precise with a shade like this—nor do you really have to worry about chips.) 

﻿Dior ($27)

item.title: 16 Celebrities You Didn’t Know Adopted Kids
item.description:
Image credit: Getty Images/Bruce Gilkas

Everyone knows about Brangelina (RIP), but there are way more celebrities out there who have gone the adoption route to expand their families. Catch a glimpse at some of the most supportive, inclusive families in Hollywood.

RELATED: Here Are The Most Popular Baby Names of 2016

Image credit: Getty Images/Marlo Magnani/Bauer Griffin

Meg Ryan

Meg Ryan

Though her biological son, Jack, was already entering his teenage years, Meg Ryan decided to adopt Daisy, a little girl from China, in 2006.

Image credit: Getty Images/Bruce Gilkas

Mary-Louise Parker

Mary-Louise Parker

Parker adopted Caroline “Ash” Aberash in 2008 and has since spoken up about tge stigma of choosing the international (versus the domestic) route.

Image credit: Getty/Jon Kopaloff

Viola Davis

Viola Davis

Viola adopted her beautiful daughter, Genesis, with her husband Julius Tennon in 2011.

Image credit: Getty Images/Axelle/Bauer-Griffin

Mariska Hargitay

Mariska Hargitay

Mariska Hargitay and husband Peter Hermann adopted Amaya Josephine in 2011 and told People that they were “deliriously happy” to grow their fam.

Image credit: Getty Images/Bennett Raglin

Kristin Davis

Kristin Davis

Much like her alter ego, Charlotte, Davis went the adoption route, bringing baby girl Gemma Rose into her family at the age of 46.

Image credit: Jacopo Raule/Getty

Sandra Bullock

Sandra Bullock

Our forever girl-crush adopted two children, Louis in 2010 and Laila in 2015.

Image credit: Getty Images/Josiah Kamau

Charlize Theron

Charlize Theron

The Mad Max: Fury Road star adopted a baby boy named Jackson in 2012. A single mother, she gave Jackson a sister, August, in 2015.

Connie Britton

Connie Britton

After flexing her parenting skills on Friday Night Lights, Connie adopted a son, Yoby, from Ethiopia in 2011. She told US Weekly We, “I didn’t think I’d have a baby on my own. But there’s a lot that comes out of having a plan and then seeing another way you can go.”

Image credit: Getty/Raymond Hall contributor

Hugh Jackman

Hugh Jackman

He and his wife, Deborra-Lee Furness, publically discussed their struggle to conceive and ultimate decision to adopt two children of their own, Oscar Maximillian and Ava Eliot (how pretty is that name?).

Denise Richards

Denise Richards

The actress had two biological children (Sam and Lola) but added adopted daughter Eloise Joni in 2011.

Sharon Stone

Sharon Stone

All three of Stone’s sons are adopted, and now range in age from 16 to 10.

Katherine Heigl

Katherine Heigl

With husband Josh Kelley, Heigl adopted Nancy Leigh Mi-Eun Kelley from South Korea, which is also the birthplace of her own adoptive sister. She added a second daughter, Adalaide Marie Hope, in 2012.

Image credit: Handout/Getty Images

Sheryl Crow

Sheryl Crow

Your favorite '90s singer has two sons, the first adopted in 2007, followed by a second in 2010. She’s spoken openly about the difficulties (and ultimate rewards) of the process.

Image credit: Rob Kim/Getty Images

Edie Falco

Edie Falco

The Sopranos star, who has two children, had always wanted to adopt. She told Parade in 2010, “I’m just not one of those people who thought having biological children was that important. To me it was more about wanting to raise a child.”

Julie Andrews

Julie Andrews

In 1974, the Mary Poppins singer and actress adopted two children from Vietnam with her husband, Blake Edwards. (We can only assume they’re practically perfect in every way.)

Image credit: Jean Baptiste Lacroix/Getty Images

Lionel Richie

Lionel Richie

Nicole Richie is actually the adopted daughter of Lionel Richie. She moved in with the singer while her biological parents were going through financial troubles in the '80s and was officially adopted six years later.

item.title: 5 Things Cool Women Never Post to Instagram
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

You’ve scrolled through her profile more than you care to admit, you know her boyfriend’s name and you even noticed when she changed her Instagram bio. It’s not that you’re a creepy stalker…it’s just that she’s so damn cool. Here, five things the ultimate cool girl would never post.

1. A Million Hashtags
Sure, it may help garner a few more likes on her photo. But it’s not worth all that clutter. She knows each shot will garner interest on its own, so she sticks one or two tags at the end of each caption and is done with it.

2. Screenshots
It’s not that the texting convo between you and your mom isn’t hysterical. It’s just that a cool girl’s Instagram is a sacred place—one for original and breathtaking content, not discussion of autocorrect. Send screenshots via text instead, where they'll be better appreciated anyway.

3. Low-Res Photos
Blurry images, dim lighting, specks on the camera lens…these are the cardinal sins of social media. 

4. Anything TMI
A pic of her shirtless hubby in bed? A shot of the scale to prove her five-pound weight-loss? We think not. A cool girl is sparing and discreet with her private life, and always remembers that less is more.

5. Anything where you can see her dirty clothes/dishes/unmade bed in the background
It’s not that she doesn’t have a sink full of dishes. It’s that she crops it out the picture, dammit.

RELATED: 7 Easy Ways to Get More Instagram Likes
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 7 Career Goals You Need to Focus On in 2017
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

After taking time to unwind through the holidays, you want to come back to your office feeling refreshed and ready to conquer the year ahead. But that’s pretty hard to do without setting specific, achievable goals. Here, seven tried-and-true methods for keeping your career climbing all the way to 2018.

RELATED: 3 Easy Ways to Unsubscribe to All of Your Annoying Emails

Image credit: Twenty20

Create a Five Year Plan

Create a Five-Year Plan

This is a great time to take stock of your long-term career aspirations. Do you want to be head of your department in half a decade? Do you want to be running your own consulting firm? Writing the dream down is the first step to committing to it. From there, write out the steps it would take to achieve your goal, then plan to hit a couple of them this year.

Image credit: Twenty20

Network Outside Your Office

Network Outside Your Office

Knowing people in your industry is not only a smart business practice; it’s good mental practice. You’ll get to talk about the ins and outs of your profession, and even if you’re not looking for a new job right now, making those valuable connections will definitely benefit you in the long run. (Or at the very least get you invited to more office Christmas parties.)

Image credit: Twenty20

Manage Your Inbox

Manage Your Inbox

This one is pretty straightforward, but it’s time to get your email habits under control. Set aside 30 minutes every day to go through and respond to requests—doing it during a designated time, rather than throughout the day, ensures nothing slips through the cracks. Start the year at 0 and keep it that way by subscribing to a service like Unroll.me, which aggregates the subscriptions that blow up your box daily.

Image credit: Twenty20

Learn a New Skill

Learn a New Skill

File this one under: personal development. It’s always a good idea to keep up on your industry practices, tools and technology changes and then educate yourself accordingly. Is your media firm getting into video this year? Sign up for a class so you’ve got a foundation and can hit the ground running.

Image credit: Twenty20

Stay Up On Your Industry

Stay Up On Your Industry

Find a blog or website dedicated to your profession and sign up for their daily newsletter. You can read it on your commute or as you ease into your day at the office. Keeping tabs on the changes taking place in your field will equip you with the knowledge to continue slaying far into 2017 (and beyond).

Image credit: Twenty20

Improve Your Work-Life Balance

Improve Your Work-Life Balance

The ever elusive work-life balance is definitely hard to get right, but you can do it! It all comes down to boundaries: What are you willing and not willing to do? If you’re absolutely not answering emails at 11 p.m., let your supervisor know. Most (good) bosses respect clearly defined boundaries. Want to leave the office earlier? Start coming in earlier to even things out.

﻿RELATED: ﻿9 Secrets of Moms Who Master Work-Life Balance

Image credit: Twenty20

Get Closer with Your Boss and Co-Workers

Get Closer with Your Boss and Coworkers

No one’s asking that you become best friends, but we can all agree it makes the workday more pleasant when you get along with the people surrounding you. Set up a monthly happy hour with your team or find a group activity you can all enjoy together. Hey, you can probably even expense it!

RELATED: 5 Smart Ways to Invest $1,000
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The One Trick for Less Blurry iPhone Photos
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Ever notice how some of your photos look crystal clear while others look like they were taken by a four-year-old? What’s up with that? Here, an easy way to ensure you never take a blurry pic again.

What you do: Open your camera app, then tap the part of the screen where you want people’s eyes to go. You’ll see a yellow box appear that corresponds to the point of focus on the image. For example, if you’re taking a picture of Big Ben, tap the tippy top of the tower, then snap away. If you’d like something in the foreground in focus—say, the amazing doughnut you’re holding out in front—tap on that before pressing down on the shutter button.

Why it works: Your phone’s auto-focus isn’t perfect and can’t be manually adjusted like those fancy DSLR lenses that photographers twist around to get the best shot. So tapping the screen helps your smartphone camera recognize what you’d like to bring into clear definition. 

That’s it? Yep, you’re just a tap away from the best damn food-in-the-air Insta we’ve ever seen. 

RELATED: 7 Easy Ways to Get More Instagram Likes
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 17 Ways to Be More Fit in 2017
item.description:
This is your year. The year you go to the gym every day, only eat monounsaturated fat and have a stomach so flat, people will openly weep when they see you in a bathing suit. OK, probably not. But here are 17 little things to do in 2017 for a fitter you.

RELATED: 6 Proven Ways to Keep Your Summer Energy Through Fall and Winter

Image credit: Cyano66/Getty Images

Element 1

1. Start every day with a tall glass of water to jump-start your metabolism. (No, not coffee. We said water.)

2. …Then do a quick, ten-minute sun salutation. You'll embrace the day with positivity and relaxation and while you’re at it, work out that kink in your neck.

3. Walk or bike to work at least once a week. If it’s totally impossible to get there without a car, take a 15-minute walk around the neighborhood before you leave.

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 2

4. Swap out one wine date per week with an exercise date. Running, biking and hiking is twice as fun with a buddy.

5. Binge-watch as much TV as you want… but do jumping jacks during commercials and sit-ups during the credits. 

6. Use a grocery basket instead of a cart. You’ll tone your triceps while you shop. 

RELATED: 9 Ways to Have a Less Expensive Supermarket Trip

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 3

7. For the last minute of your workout, push yourself extra hard. Sprint, do an extra rep or bike around the block one last time to really make it count. 

8. Instead of ordering in, save the delivery guy a trip and walk or bike to go get your Chinese food.

9. Always hike the same route? Try the more challenging one next time. And the time after that. And the time after that.

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 4

10. Outlaw escalators. Find the stairs and use them every single time. (Unless you’re carrying a 50-pound suitcase. Then we’ll make an exception.)

11. Instead of watching your kids play flashlight tag, get in on the game, too. (You’re it.)

12. Go for a walk after dinner instead of watching that Friends rerun. 

13. Try a new workout class once a month. It’ll stave off gym fatigue and keep you from plateauing in your usual Pilates session. 

RELATED: 8 Ways to Get Out of a Workout Rut When You Really, Really Don’t Feel Like Exercising

Image credit: Twenty20

Element 5

14. Go skiing this winter. (Even if you suck, you’ll burn 300 calories an hour.) 

15. Find a sport you actually love. Remember ice-skating? And swimming? And Ping-Pong? Way more fun than the elliptical.

16. Do something that scares you at least once this year. Always wanted to go rock climbing, bungee jumping or white-water rafting? Now’s your chance. 

17. Reward yourself. After a week of making healthy choices, get a massage. You’ve earned it, lady. 

RELATED: 9 Secrets of Women Who Exercise Daily
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: 12 Kids’ Brands You’re Probably Mispronouncing
item.description:
You’ve finally mastered the pronunciation of Kérastase (care-a-stoss), Gruyère (groo-yair) and LaCroix (la-croy). And then you had kids, and suddenly there are a billion other impossible-to-pronounce brands in your life. Don’t worry, we’re here to help.

Stokke

Aden + Anais

Medela

Medela

Robeez

Robeez

Svan

Chicco

Britax

The right way: brye-tax 

This car seat brand has been commonly mispronounced since 1938 (but props for sticking with the name, guys).

Image credit: Oeuf

Oeuf

Oeuf

The wrong way: oh-ee-uf

The right way: oof

As in, “Oof, that unicorn hat costs $56.”

Image credit: Tsukihoshi

Tsukihoshi

Tsukihoshi

The wrong way: too-ki-hosh-ee

The right way: sue-key-ho-shee 

Say it five times fast.

Image credit: Polarn O. Pyret

Polarn O. Pyret

Polarn O. Pyret

The wrong way: po-layrn-oh-pie-ret 

The right way: poh-lahrn-oh-pee-ret

These Scandinavian children are silently judging you. So get it right.

item.title: 11 Things We Can't Wait to Wear in 2017
item.description:
Right now you’re probably trekking around in a giant puffy coat and two pairs of socks, but soon enough it will be spring, aka that wonderful time of the year when you can finally shed your layers and wear cute clothes again. Namely, these 11 trends we’re already daydreaming about for 2017.

RELATED: The 7 Best Sweater Trends for 2016 and 2017

Image credit: Estrop/Getty Images

Wallpaper-Esque Florals

Wallpaper-Esque Florals

Remember how people decorated their houses in, like, 1972? That, in a nutshell, is how we want to dress come spring. Basically, we’re into any outfit (Michael Kors especially) that warrants the adjective “groovy.”

Image credit: Victor VIRGILE/Getty Images

Modern Khaki

Modern Khaki

Chino fabric doesn’t seem inherently groundbreaking, but come 2017, we’re looking forward to wearing it in unexpected ways, like ruffled skirts (thanks, J.Crew), pretty blouses and, of course, our go-to trench coat.

RELATED: The Only 15 Things You Need to Build the Perfect Wardrobe

Image credit: Victor VIRGILE/Getty Images

Bold Stripes

Bold Stripes

A striped tee is one thing, but in the New Year we’re looking forward to going a little bigger where stripes are concerned. This could mean giant sequined stripes (a la Rosie Assoulin) or it could also mean a slightly updated spin on your favorite nautical sweater.

Image credit: Estrop/Getty Images

Statement-Making Tees

Statement-Making Tees

Graphic tees can be tough to pull off as a grown woman. They can sometimes read a little immature or sloppy, but tucked into a high-waisted skirt and topped with a pretty necklace (like Dior did here), the look is surprisingly refined.

RELATED: 8 Super-Chic Ways to Dress Up a White Tee

Image credit: Estrop/Getty Images

Heart Motifs

Heart Motifs

Whether worn on your sleeve or across your chest, expect hearts to be all over the place come spring. If the Proenza Schouler look above is a little aggressive for your taste, find smaller graphics that spread the love subtly.

Image credit: Victor VIRGILE/Getty Images

Fuchsia

Fuchsia

Pastel pink had its moment, but we’re ready for something a little brighter—and vibrant fuchsia is just the thing we’re looking for. If you’re not ready to go all out with a solid Sportmax dress, start with fuchsia-hued accessories before graduating to the bigger stuff (if you’re into that sort of thing).

Image credit: Estrop/Getty Images

High, Ruffled Necklines

High, Ruffled Necklines

A welcome change from plunging V necks, Victorian-inspired tops are elegant and appropriate without being too stuffy. Take a cue from Burberry and layer one under a printed jacket to keep the silhouette modern and cool.

RELATED: 15 Work-Appropriate Blazers for Under $100

Image credit: Ilya S. Savenok/Getty Images

Dresses Over Pants

Dresses Over Pants

Well, isn’t this a chic throwback? (Courtesy of Banana Republic.) To keep this often-maligned trend looking elegant, stick to neutral color combinations (like black and white) and long, clean lines that ensure a flattering end result.

RELATED: 13 Unexpected Ways to Layer Fall Clothes

Image credit: Estrop/Getty Images

Appropriate Bustiers

Appropriate Bustiers

When you think bustier, you probably think bedroom, but worn atop a modest dress, it functions more like a wide belt, cinching your waist in a super-flattering way. (You can thank Tibi for the inspiration.)

Image credit: Peter White/Getty Images

Loud Earrings

Loud Earrings

Diamond studs these are not—and we’re obsessed. Over-the-top earrings are the easiest way to jazz up an otherwise plain outfit, a great conversation piece and just really fun to wear. Now, who’s got Naeem Khan’s number?

RELATED: 6 Timeless Jewelry Pieces That Will Never Go Out of Style

Image credit: Fernanda Calfat/Getty Images

Mini Bags

Mini Bags

Consider making one of your New Year’s resolutions to stop carrying around so much unnecessary stuff, especially since some of our favorite bags for spring can hold next to nothing. Petite purses are delicate and feminine (sigh, Delpozo) and aren’t a pain to lug around all day.

RELATED: How to Carry Every Kind of Handbag
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: The Secret Ingredient That Will Make Pancakes Taste Incredible
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Homemade pancakes are tricky. When they’re fluffy and light, there’s nothing better for breakfast. But when they’re bland, lumpy and stick to the pan, ew. If your short stack is a little blah, you’ve probably been overlooking a simple ingredient that will take your pancakes from good to incredible.

That secret ingredient is bacon grease. 

Here's how to do it: Heat your skillet, but instead of using oil or butter to coat the pan, add a dab of bacon grease. Then cook your pancakes as you normally would, flipping them when the batter begins to bubble.

If you’re cooking bacon first (which we strongly suggest), just remove the bacon from the pan, dispose of any excess grease and keep a dollop in the skillet. Then spoon your pancake batter right on the greased pan.

The result: Pancakes that are doughy on the inside, crispy around the edges and taste amazing. Pile 'em high, drizzle with maple syrup and enjoy. And while you’re at it, scramble some eggs.

RELATED: 18 Insanely Delicious Ways to Cook with Bacon Grease
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Here’s How to Get Upgraded to First Class on Your Next Flight
item.description:
Sure, you saved a boatload by booking a seat in coach—but what if you could have flown first class for free? Here, five ways to sweet talk move your way to the front of the plane.

RELATED: Why You Might Save Money by Flying First Class

Image credit: Universal Pictures

Avoid Flights That Take Off During “Business” Hours

Avoid Flights That Take Off During “Business” Hours

For example, the 6:30 a.m. shuttle from Logan to LaGuardia. Here’s why: Flights that are frequently traveled by the business set (ahem, the ones on their way to work) tend to have the most competition for premium seats. A better plan for scoring a first-class upgrade? If you have travel flexibility, opt for a flight that takes off midday.

Image credit: Dreamworks

And Do Everything You Can to Prove Airline Loyalty

And Do Everything You Can to Prove Airline Loyalty

You love JetBlue, but if you haven’t enrolled in its frequent flier program—or better yet, signed up for a credit card—you could be shortchanging yourself a first-class (in this case, JetBlue Mint) upgrade. After all, gate attendants tune into these “status” symbols when you make an upgrade request. If you have physical evidence (like a branded credit card or rewards email in your inbox) of your devotion, your odds of getting a free first-class bump dramatically improve.

Image credit: NBC

Always (Always) Dress to Impress

Always (Always) Dress to Impress

If you look like you just rolled out of bed, gate attendants are much less likely to plunk you down next to Oprah (or some other VIP seatmate). Take a shower. Blow your hair out. Even if you’re wearing leggings, you can still look like you put some effort in. 

RELATED: Celebrity-Approved Airport Style You Might Want to Try

Image credit: Comedy Central

Use an App to Keep Tabs on Seat Availability

Use an App to Keep Tabs on Seat Availability

Knowledge is power. Seat Alerts is an app that allows you to keep tabs on seat availability and occupancy for flights on over 120 airlines. That way, you’ll know when there are a bunch of empty seats still left in first class and can use that info to your advantage when you step up to request a free upgrade.

Image credit: NBC

Ask Nicely

Ask Nicely

Sure, it may sound like basic advice. But treating the gate attendant with respect and showing appreciation when they try to help you out can go a long way. 

RELATED: 12 Ways to Make Your Plane Ride More Comfortable
item.author: editor@purewow.com (PureWow)

item.title: Why a Chef Would Never Order Salmon at a Restaurant
item.description:
Image credit: Twenty20

Eating out at a restaurant can be a total gamble. Sometimes you have the best meal of your life, and sometimes, well, not so much. So we consulted the pros: Josh Ochoa and Andy Alexandre, chefs at Ruffian Wine Bar & Chef’s Table in New York City, are revealing the dishes they’d never, ever order when dining in a restaurant. Take notes.

RELATED: 5 Drinks a Bartender Would Never Order in a Bar

Image credit: Twenty20

Dollar Oysters

Dollar Oysters

If the restaurant is letting them go for this cheap, you aren’t getting a deal—they’re just really, really low-quality oysters. Stick with a seafood spot that specializes in oysters (they’ll probably be at least $2 a piece). And don’t even think about eating them if they have a fishy smell.

Image credit: kivoart/Getty Images

Green Salads

Green Salads

A salad should be just as exciting as every other appetizer on the menu. In other words, a mesclun mix is a total snooze-fest. Order literally any other app and chances are, you’ll be much more satisfied.

Image credit: Fudio/Getty Images

Ceviche

Ceviche

…Oh, wait, except this app. Ceviche, a Latin American dish made with raw fish “cooked” in lemon juice, requires high-quality fish to be done right. More often than not, this isn’t the case, making for a taste that’s tough and chewy. You’re safer with a cooked fish appetizer instead, like sardines.

RELATED: 6 Mistakes You’re Probably Making When You Cook Fish

Image credit: Twenty20

Feta and Watermelon

Feta and Watermelon

Whether it’s in a salad or as an appetizer, this flavor combo just doesn’t work, the Ruffian chefs insist: “Every time we’ve ordered this dish, it’s been disappointing.” Let’s save the watermelon for a picnic and the feta for shakshuka, shall we?

Image credit: Twenty20

Salmon

Salmon

How many pieces of salmon have you had in your lifetime? 580? Were any of them particularly memorable? Nope, we didn’t think so. Order a flavorful fish stew or a mussels dish instead—broaden your horizons, people.
